Podcast

              / Asia
04 April 2025



Will Myanmar’s Devastating Earthquake Impact its Civil War?


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks with Crisis Group’s Myanmar expert Richard Horsey about the devastating earthquake that struck Myanmar last week, challenges facing relief efforts and implications for the country’s civil war and its military leaders.













Podcast

              / Africa
28 March 2025



South Sudan on the Brink of Another War


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Daniel Akech and Alan Boswell about escalating violence across South Sudan, President Salva Kiir’s dismissal of both loyalists and opposition leaders, the impact of neighbouring Sudan’s conflict and hope of averting a return to civil war in the world’s youngest country.













Podcast

              / Africa
27 March 2025



Which Way Will Trump Go on Somalia?


This week on The Horn, Alan talks with Crisis Group’s Somalia expert Omar Mahmood about what the impact of a major Trump pivot on Somalia could look like, as well as Al-Shabaab’s new offensive and the recent thaw in Ethiopia-Somalia relations.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
25 March 2025



Latin America’s Evolving Drug Trade. Why It Matters for Europe


This week on War & Peace, Olga and Elissa are joined by Crisis Group experts Renata Segura and Elizabeth Dickinson to discuss the evolving landscape of drug trafficking in Latin America and how Europe can help tackle the violence it leaves in its wake.













Podcast

              / Middle East & North Africa
22 March 2025



Israel Goes Back to War in Gaza


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks to Crisis Group experts Max Rodenbeck, Mairav Zonszein, Amjad Iraqi and Michael Wahid Hanna about Israel’s return to war in Gaza, the implications for the strip’s inhabitants, the U.S. air raids on the Houthis in Yemen and President Donald Trump’s Middle East policy.













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
18 March 2025



Sans l’USAID, l’assistance humanitaire en Afrique est-elle menacée ?


Dans cet épisode d’Afrique 360°, Enrica Picco et Rinaldo Depagne reçoivent Stéphane Doyon, membre du département des opérations de Médecins Sans Frontières, pour parler de la suspension de l’aide internationale américaine et de ses conséquences sur l’assistance humanitaire et au développement en Afrique.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
17 March 2025



Trump, France and European Security


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Gérard Araud, Crisis Group Trustee and former French ambassador to the U.S., the UN and Israel about Donald Trump’s foreign policy, transatlantic relations, prospects for diplomacy over Ukraine and France’s role in European security.













Podcast

              / Africa
14 March 2025



Ethiopia and Eritrea, On a Collision Course


This week on The Horn, Alan speaks with Michael Woldemariam, associate professor at the University of Maryland, about the escalating tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea, the political crisis in Tigray and whether a renewed outbreak of war can still be averted.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
07 March 2025



What Does the PKK Ceasefire Mean for Türkiye, Iraq and Syria? 


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Berkay Mandıracı, Lahib Higel and Dareen Khalifa about PKK leader Abdullah Öcalan’s statement calling on the PKK to disarm and disband and the PKK’s subsequent ceasefire announcement, Türkiye’s possible motivations for ending the conflict and implications for the PKK and its affiliates in Syria. 













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
05 March 2025



The Aid System is Collapsing. Now What?


This week on The Horn, Alan Boswell speaks with Sarah Pantuliano, Chief Executive Officer of ODI Global, about the implications of the Trump administration’s slashing of foreign aid, a broader trend of declining aid budgets, and the future of humanitarianism.

Podcast

              / Asia
04 April 2025



Will Myanmar’s Devastating Earthquake Impact its Civil War?


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks with Crisis Group’s Myanmar expert Richard Horsey about the devastating earthquake that struck Myanmar last week, challenges facing relief efforts and implications for the country’s civil war and its military leaders.













Podcast

              / Africa
28 March 2025



South Sudan on the Brink of Another War


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Daniel Akech and Alan Boswell about escalating violence across South Sudan, President Salva Kiir’s dismissal of both loyalists and opposition leaders, the impact of neighbouring Sudan’s conflict and hope of averting a return to civil war in the world’s youngest country.













Podcast

              / Africa
27 March 2025



Which Way Will Trump Go on Somalia?


This week on The Horn, Alan talks with Crisis Group’s Somalia expert Omar Mahmood about what the impact of a major Trump pivot on Somalia could look like, as well as Al-Shabaab’s new offensive and the recent thaw in Ethiopia-Somalia relations.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
25 March 2025



Latin America’s Evolving Drug Trade. Why It Matters for Europe


This week on War & Peace, Olga and Elissa are joined by Crisis Group experts Renata Segura and Elizabeth Dickinson to discuss the evolving landscape of drug trafficking in Latin America and how Europe can help tackle the violence it leaves in its wake.













Podcast

              / Middle East & North Africa
22 March 2025



Israel Goes Back to War in Gaza


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks to Crisis Group experts Max Rodenbeck, Mairav Zonszein, Amjad Iraqi and Michael Wahid Hanna about Israel’s return to war in Gaza, the implications for the strip’s inhabitants, the U.S. air raids on the Houthis in Yemen and President Donald Trump’s Middle East policy.













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
18 March 2025



Sans l’USAID, l’assistance humanitaire en Afrique est-elle menacée ?


Dans cet épisode d’Afrique 360°, Enrica Picco et Rinaldo Depagne reçoivent Stéphane Doyon, membre du département des opérations de Médecins Sans Frontières, pour parler de la suspension de l’aide internationale américaine et de ses conséquences sur l’assistance humanitaire et au développement en Afrique.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
17 March 2025



Trump, France and European Security


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Gérard Araud, Crisis Group Trustee and former French ambassador to the U.S., the UN and Israel about Donald Trump’s foreign policy, transatlantic relations, prospects for diplomacy over Ukraine and France’s role in European security.













Podcast

              / Africa
14 March 2025



Ethiopia and Eritrea, On a Collision Course


This week on The Horn, Alan speaks with Michael Woldemariam, associate professor at the University of Maryland, about the escalating tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea, the political crisis in Tigray and whether a renewed outbreak of war can still be averted.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
07 March 2025



What Does the PKK Ceasefire Mean for Türkiye, Iraq and Syria? 


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Berkay Mandıracı, Lahib Higel and Dareen Khalifa about PKK leader Abdullah Öcalan’s statement calling on the PKK to disarm and disband and the PKK’s subsequent ceasefire announcement, Türkiye’s possible motivations for ending the conflict and implications for the PKK and its affiliates in Syria. 













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
05 March 2025



The Aid System is Collapsing. Now What?


This week on The Horn, Alan Boswell speaks with Sarah Pantuliano, Chief Executive Officer of ODI Global, about the implications of the Trump administration’s slashing of foreign aid, a broader trend of declining aid budgets, and the future of humanitarianism.

18 March 2025



Sans l’USAID, l’assistance humanitaire en Afrique est-elle menacée ?


Dans cet épisode d’Afrique 360°, Enrica Picco et Rinaldo Depagne reçoivent Stéphane Doyon, membre du département des opérations de Médecins Sans Frontières, pour parler de la suspension de l’aide internationale américaine et de ses conséquences sur l’assistance humanitaire et au développement en Afrique.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
17 March 2025



Trump, France and European Security


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Gérard Araud, Crisis Group Trustee and former French ambassador to the U.S., the UN and Israel about Donald Trump’s foreign policy, transatlantic relations, prospects for diplomacy over Ukraine and France’s role in European security.













Podcast

              / Africa
14 March 2025



Ethiopia and Eritrea, On a Collision Course


This week on The Horn, Alan speaks with Michael Woldemariam, associate professor at the University of Maryland, about the escalating tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea, the political crisis in Tigray and whether a renewed outbreak of war can still be averted.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
07 March 2025



What Does the PKK Ceasefire Mean for Türkiye, Iraq and Syria? 


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Berkay Mandıracı, Lahib Higel and Dareen Khalifa about PKK leader Abdullah Öcalan’s statement calling on the PKK to disarm and disband and the PKK’s subsequent ceasefire announcement, Türkiye’s possible motivations for ending the conflict and implications for the PKK and its affiliates in Syria. 













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
05 March 2025



The Aid System is Collapsing. Now What?


This week on The Horn, Alan Boswell speaks with Sarah Pantuliano, Chief Executive Officer of ODI Global, about the implications of the Trump administration’s slashing of foreign aid, a broader trend of declining aid budgets, and the future of humanitarianism.

Podcast

              / Asia
04 April 2025



Will Myanmar’s Devastating Earthquake Impact its Civil War?


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks with Crisis Group’s Myanmar expert Richard Horsey about the devastating earthquake that struck Myanmar last week, challenges facing relief efforts and implications for the country’s civil war and its military leaders.













Podcast

              / Africa
28 March 2025



South Sudan on the Brink of Another War


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Daniel Akech and Alan Boswell about escalating violence across South Sudan, President Salva Kiir’s dismissal of both loyalists and opposition leaders, the impact of neighbouring Sudan’s conflict and hope of averting a return to civil war in the world’s youngest country.













Podcast

              / Africa
27 March 2025



Which Way Will Trump Go on Somalia?


This week on The Horn, Alan talks with Crisis Group’s Somalia expert Omar Mahmood about what the impact of a major Trump pivot on Somalia could look like, as well as Al-Shabaab’s new offensive and the recent thaw in Ethiopia-Somalia relations.

25 March 2025



Latin America’s Evolving Drug Trade. Why It Matters for Europe


This week on War & Peace, Olga and Elissa are joined by Crisis Group experts Renata Segura and Elizabeth Dickinson to discuss the evolving landscape of drug trafficking in Latin America and how Europe can help tackle the violence it leaves in its wake.

Israel Goes Back to War in Gaza

Podcast

              / Asia
04 April 2025



Will Myanmar’s Devastating Earthquake Impact its Civil War?


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks with Crisis Group’s Myanmar expert Richard Horsey about the devastating earthquake that struck Myanmar last week, challenges facing relief efforts and implications for the country’s civil war and its military leaders.













Podcast

              / Africa
28 March 2025



South Sudan on the Brink of Another War


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Daniel Akech and Alan Boswell about escalating violence across South Sudan, President Salva Kiir’s dismissal of both loyalists and opposition leaders, the impact of neighbouring Sudan’s conflict and hope of averting a return to civil war in the world’s youngest country.













Podcast

              / Africa
27 March 2025



Which Way Will Trump Go on Somalia?


This week on The Horn, Alan talks with Crisis Group’s Somalia expert Omar Mahmood about what the impact of a major Trump pivot on Somalia could look like, as well as Al-Shabaab’s new offensive and the recent thaw in Ethiopia-Somalia relations.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
25 March 2025



Latin America’s Evolving Drug Trade. Why It Matters for Europe


This week on War & Peace, Olga and Elissa are joined by Crisis Group experts Renata Segura and Elizabeth Dickinson to discuss the evolving landscape of drug trafficking in Latin America and how Europe can help tackle the violence it leaves in its wake.













Podcast

              / Middle East & North Africa
22 March 2025



Israel Goes Back to War in Gaza


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks to Crisis Group experts Max Rodenbeck, Mairav Zonszein, Amjad Iraqi and Michael Wahid Hanna about Israel’s return to war in Gaza, the implications for the strip’s inhabitants, the U.S. air raids on the Houthis in Yemen and President Donald Trump’s Middle East policy.













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
18 March 2025



Sans l’USAID, l’assistance humanitaire en Afrique est-elle menacée ?


Dans cet épisode d’Afrique 360°, Enrica Picco et Rinaldo Depagne reçoivent Stéphane Doyon, membre du département des opérations de Médecins Sans Frontières, pour parler de la suspension de l’aide internationale américaine et de ses conséquences sur l’assistance humanitaire et au développement en Afrique.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
17 March 2025



Trump, France and European Security


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Gérard Araud, Crisis Group Trustee and former French ambassador to the U.S., the UN and Israel about Donald Trump’s foreign policy, transatlantic relations, prospects for diplomacy over Ukraine and France’s role in European security.













Podcast

              / Africa
14 March 2025



Ethiopia and Eritrea, On a Collision Course


This week on The Horn, Alan speaks with Michael Woldemariam, associate professor at the University of Maryland, about the escalating tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea, the political crisis in Tigray and whether a renewed outbreak of war can still be averted.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
07 March 2025



What Does the PKK Ceasefire Mean for Türkiye, Iraq and Syria? 


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Berkay Mandıracı, Lahib Higel and Dareen Khalifa about PKK leader Abdullah Öcalan’s statement calling on the PKK to disarm and disband and the PKK’s subsequent ceasefire announcement, Türkiye’s possible motivations for ending the conflict and implications for the PKK and its affiliates in Syria. 













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
05 March 2025



The Aid System is Collapsing. Now What?


This week on The Horn, Alan Boswell speaks with Sarah Pantuliano, Chief Executive Officer of ODI Global, about the implications of the Trump administration’s slashing of foreign aid, a broader trend of declining aid budgets, and the future of humanitarianism.

This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks with Crisis Group’s Myanmar expert Richard Horsey about the devastating earthquake that struck Myanmar last week, challenges facing relief efforts and implications for the country’s civil war and its military leaders.













Podcast

              / Africa
28 March 2025



South Sudan on the Brink of Another War


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Daniel Akech and Alan Boswell about escalating violence across South Sudan, President Salva Kiir’s dismissal of both loyalists and opposition leaders, the impact of neighbouring Sudan’s conflict and hope of averting a return to civil war in the world’s youngest country.













Podcast

              / Africa
27 March 2025



Which Way Will Trump Go on Somalia?


This week on The Horn, Alan talks with Crisis Group’s Somalia expert Omar Mahmood about what the impact of a major Trump pivot on Somalia could look like, as well as Al-Shabaab’s new offensive and the recent thaw in Ethiopia-Somalia relations.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
25 March 2025



Latin America’s Evolving Drug Trade. Why It Matters for Europe


This week on War & Peace, Olga and Elissa are joined by Crisis Group experts Renata Segura and Elizabeth Dickinson to discuss the evolving landscape of drug trafficking in Latin America and how Europe can help tackle the violence it leaves in its wake.













Podcast

              / Middle East & North Africa
22 March 2025



Israel Goes Back to War in Gaza


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard Atwood speaks to Crisis Group experts Max Rodenbeck, Mairav Zonszein, Amjad Iraqi and Michael Wahid Hanna about Israel’s return to war in Gaza, the implications for the strip’s inhabitants, the U.S. air raids on the Houthis in Yemen and President Donald Trump’s Middle East policy.













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
18 March 2025



Sans l’USAID, l’assistance humanitaire en Afrique est-elle menacée ?


Dans cet épisode d’Afrique 360°, Enrica Picco et Rinaldo Depagne reçoivent Stéphane Doyon, membre du département des opérations de Médecins Sans Frontières, pour parler de la suspension de l’aide internationale américaine et de ses conséquences sur l’assistance humanitaire et au développement en Afrique.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
17 March 2025



Trump, France and European Security


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Gérard Araud, Crisis Group Trustee and former French ambassador to the U.S., the UN and Israel about Donald Trump’s foreign policy, transatlantic relations, prospects for diplomacy over Ukraine and France’s role in European security.













Podcast

              / Africa
14 March 2025



Ethiopia and Eritrea, On a Collision Course


This week on The Horn, Alan speaks with Michael Woldemariam, associate professor at the University of Maryland, about the escalating tensions between Ethiopia and Eritrea, the political crisis in Tigray and whether a renewed outbreak of war can still be averted.













Podcast

              / Europe & Central Asia
07 March 2025



What Does the PKK Ceasefire Mean for Türkiye, Iraq and Syria? 


This week on Hold Your Fire!, Richard speaks with Crisis Group experts Berkay Mandıracı, Lahib Higel and Dareen Khalifa about PKK leader Abdullah Öcalan’s statement calling on the PKK to disarm and disband and the PKK’s subsequent ceasefire announcement, Türkiye’s possible motivations for ending the conflict and implications for the PKK and its affiliates in Syria. 













Podcast

              / Multilateral Diplomacy
05 March 2025



The Aid System is Collapsing. Now What?


This week on The Horn, Alan Boswell speaks with Sarah Pantuliano, Chief Executive Officer of ODI Global, about the implications of the Trump administration’s slashing of foreign aid, a broader trend of declining aid budgets, and the future of humanitarianism.
